title: Bizarre moment 'zombie' shoppers force their way under a store's front shutter
text:
Shoppers desperate to get their hands on promotional eggs look like 'zombies' as they crawl under a supermarket's shutters.

The bizarre footage from Sanjiang Supermarket in Qingdao, east China, shows the 'middle-aged' customers bend the metal gate as they rush to get into the store.

They are on their hands and knees as they scramble through the small gap, leaving staff stunned in disbelief.

The bizarre footage from Sanjiang Supermarket in Qingdao, east China, shows the 'middle-aged' customers bend the metal gate as they rush to get into the store (pictured)

They are on their hands and knees as they scramble through the small gap, leaving staff stunned in disbelief

One woman has to use the shop's anti-theft system to help her up off the floor, while a man grabs hold of a trolley to assist him.

And an elderly customer appears to get stuck on his knees as others barge through him without helping.

After they get past the barrier, the shoppers race towards the egg aisle for the limited-time deal of 1kg of fresh eggs for 4 RMB (46p).

One woman has to use the shop's anti-theft system to help her up off the floor (centre), while a man grabs hold of a trolley to assist him

And one elderly customer appears to get stuck on his knees as others barge past him (centre) without helping

Each customer was only allowed one purchase while stocks lasted and the eggs were snatched up in minutes.

Social media users described the mob of eager shoppers as being 'like zombies'.

Ruo Yang, a user on Weibo - China's equivalent to Twitter - wrote: 'They're like zombies from the game Dead Rising!

'Are we really meant to give up our bus seats to them?'
